titleStmt.author: Virginia Woolf

handNote.p: Holograph writing by the documents' main hand, Virginia Woolf

msIdentifier.repository: Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature

physDesc.p: M54. [Anon] Typescript fragments, unsigned and undated, 33p. Fragmentary pagination and not consecutive with the other typescript fragments. On verso of p. 11 unidentified holograph fragment.

correction.p: Apparent errors have been explicitly corrected in / tags, wrapped in a element.

normalization.p: Where appropriate, spelling and punctuation have been modernised using / tags, wrapped in a element.

interpretation.p: Names and references to places and literary works have been wrapped in tags which link to annotations and secondary material.

projectDesc.p: Text encoded as part of 'The Digital "Anon": A Digital Genetic Edition of Virginia Woolf's Final Essays'. This project, funded by Leverhulme Grant ECF-2022-602, seeks to construct a TEI-XML based digital edition of the drafts of 'Anon' and 'The Reader', among the final documents Woolf wrote before her death.

p.l: The printing press brought the past into existence.

It brought into existence the man who is conscious of the
pat past
the man who sees his time, zzzzz against a back ground of
the past; the man who firsts sees himself and shows himself
to us. xmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmmm The first
blow has been aimed at Anon when the authors name is attached

his
mae name is also Harrison. Harrison emerging from the past
tells us that he has a library; that he owns a mastiff;

that he digs up Roman coins. He tells us that he has
nev ben never been
more than forty miles from radwinter in Essex. Anon is
losing his ambiguity. The present is becoming visible.

Harrison sees the pxmxmxmxmsx the present
agains against the

settled
reroded recorded past. The past looks
degnerate degenerate , raw,
against that past.
Upstairs in the great room , as he tells us, "our ancient
ladies of the court" were to be found reading the
Greeks and the Latins. as they sat at their needlework.

And the
sch;ars scholars in the
c ege college library were reading the

classics that were chained to the
shlves shelves in the
college libraries. He turned away from the actors who

even while he dug up
voins coins in his garden were acting their

crude
darams dramas in the market place. Hxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxm
atxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxxmmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmx
wexmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmmxx Yet in spite of
the printed book and the new learning, the the
common people were still at their lewd practises.
The historians work from the outer to the inner; from the

house they infer the
teant tenant of the house. It is the house
thy they
dwell upon; the chairs and the furniture of the house.

It is as if we were told

and the voice of Anon singing at the back door the English

a race of
me rhcnats merchants , soldiers and
preists priests builders who left behind
thm them
stone houses, cultivated fields and vast cathedrals. but
not no words. The great house is silent; Only the furniture

mains remains , stiff and ornate,
fanastic fantastic and uncushioned.
At Gorhambury for instance Lady Bacon sat at her table
writing letters. But Her letters to her son are letter written [illeg.]
from the pulpit; as intricate involved and formal as state

papers or legal documents or
dyin depositons dying depositions . She admonishes and preaches;
suspicions of her soul. She is a counsellor admonishing a

subordinate. She is aware expressive only of
th the wickedness of
men, the dangers and deceits of the world; and the
awfu;ness awfulness of her God. Greek and Latin come to her pen

as easily as English. If she has to
decend descend to the actual

a basket of
starwberries strawberries -- it is with
